title: It's really fun how shit early game is for new players, the amount of bots and dodges is disgusting
body:
#Play Coop?

Less XP than PVP, roll the dice on whether or not you have poorly coded XP farmers on your team doing nothing but making it hard NOT to lose because of the fed AFK-shoving AI on the enemy side.

#Play PVP?

_**Blind Pick:**_ No one calls out their picks, no one is willing to build a supp item and fights for farm, pretty much everyone is a smurf because no new people ever really can put up with and stay in the garbage League has devolved into, whoever gets the 3+ man premade on their side wins.

_**ARAM:**_ Lobby Dodge, Lobby Dodge, Lobby Dodge, You get a game but one of your teammates is a bot, Lobby Dodge, Lobby Dodge, Lobby Dodge, You get a game and see the exact same Champs as last one but this time all of yours are the melees, Lobby Dodge, Lobby Dodge, Lobby Dodge, Lobby Dodge, LOBBY DODGE, LOBBY DODGE, _LOBBY DODGE,_ **_LOBBY DODGE,_** You get in a game with TWO BOTS ON YOUR SIDE THIS TIME! WEREN'T THOSE 10 MINUTES YOU SPENT HEARING ALL THOSE JOIN-LOBBY POP-UPS WORTH IT?!

It's actually shameful how awful the gaming experience is, I truly feel bad knowing just how many people queue up for the first time and quit after going through trash like this back to back.

replies.body: Riot hasn't had the resources to care about early player experience for a while. Their currency update was basically a hosefest.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Fuzzi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-02-18T02:57:09.654+0000)
>
> Riot hasn't had the resources to care about early player experience for a while. Their currency update was basically a hosefest.

Which is obviously blatantly wrong, considering all the work they put into free stuff.

The problem cannot easily be fixed. What would _you_ do to fix it?

What I would do to fix it is actually invest some man power into Riot's bone-dry near-useless "Support Group" that are SUPPOSED to be there to handle things like XP Farming AI that infest Coop and ARAM.

> [{quoted}](name=ComeGankMeBro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-18T03:19:05.421+0000)
>
> What I would do to fix it is actually invest some man power into Riot's bone-dry near-useless "Support Group" that are SUPPOSED to be there to handle things like XP Farming AI that infest Coop and ARAM.

So basically, you dont know either and your answer is "throw money at it until it magically works".

If that worked, riot would do it. It does not work, though. The sheer volume of games makes that utterly unfeasible.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-18T03:20:37.303+0000)
>
> So basically, you dont know either and your answer is "throw money at it until it magically works".
> 
> If that worked, riot would do it. It does not work, though. The sheer volume of games makes that utterly unfeasible.

He answered you though? What else is there to be done aside from assign more people into the Support Group where their job is to sift through replays and find evidence of these bots?

Cause what they're doing right now is clearly not working, and as we've seen time and time again Riot can be ridiculously incompetent and almost actively AVOID the simplest of solutions so no they wouldn't do it even if it worked unless they had no other choice.

> [{quoted}](name=Timely Voidling,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=00000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-02-18T03:25:37.048+0000)
>
> He answered you though? What else is there to be done aside from assign more people into the Support Group where their job is to sift through replays and find evidence of these bots?
> 
> Cause what they're doing right now is clearly not working, and as we've seen time and time again Riot can be ridiculously incompetent and almost actively AVOID the simplest of solutions so no they wouldn't do it even if it worked unless they had no other choice.

What they need is better automated detection. Neural networks taught to detect bots without false positives based on cues humans cant even see (like reaction times, mouse movement patterns, action rate). Bad ARAM players can be so godawful they can seem like bots.

And how are these things developed exactly?

Cause based on this answer alone you should be feeling very stupid about your "Hiring more people to tackle the problem won't work" comment right now.

> [{quoted}](name=ComeGankMeBro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=0000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-02-18T03:40:16.959+0000)
>
> And how are these things developed exactly?
> 
> Cause based on this answer alone you should be feeling very stupid about your "Hiring more people to tackle the problem won't work" comment right now.

You dont get an anticheat neural network made by throwing money at unskilled workers, especially the support team, or even hiring more programmers. You get it made by having your developers get enough time to work on it.

Someone without an in-depth understanding of the game (how it is played and how the software works) is not going to be able to make anything useful and accurate.
Then I guess it's true that riot doesn't play their own game seeing as the current system is anything but useful and accurate.

> [{quoted}](name=ComeGankMeBro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=000000000000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-18T13:11:04.113+0000)
>
> Then I guess it's true that riot doesn't play their own game seeing as the current system is anything but useful and accurate.

The current system uses a crude heuristic based on human-defined rules. It cant do any better than a human with no knowledge of player behavior or meta, and it lacks much in the way of logic.

Neural networks are relatively new tech as far as mainstream use is concerned, and it takes a lot of time, data samples, and processing power to teach them.

You dont fix a problem just by throwing more people at something. Too many chefs in the kitchen spoil the broth. These things take time, and having a smaller group of people intimately knowledgeable on what theyre creating and what its for is better than hiring a ton of people who can do it, but are making pieces that dont fit together as well since theres too many moving parts.

Even if someone knows how to do something, it doesnt work if they dont know what is already being made, what its going to be used for, how it will interact with the specific playerbase etc.
Then I guess riot needs to stop being lazy and get to work then? Cause their current joke of a support group is clearly not working

By what metric or standard is it not working? Bot farms can set up and run hundreds of accounts to level all at the same time, and remake them as fast as theyre banned. The vast majority of them get banned rather quickly. They make profit off the few that dont.

Wow man, solid argument there.

God forbid we get MORE PEOPLE to handle such a "High volume" of games right? Clearly the number we have is good enough when they're struggling to keep up.

It _**would**_ work, Riot is just too lazy and uninterested to actually put forth the effort and fix the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=ComeGankMeBro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-18T03:22:37.328+0000)
>
> Wow man, solid argument there.
> 
> God forbid we get MORE PEOPLE to handle such a "High volume" of games right? Clearly the number we have is good enough when they're struggling to keep up.
> 
> It _**would**_ work, Riot is just too lazy and uninterested to actually put forth the effort and fix the problem.

Hiring thousands of people and training them to understand the game enough to tell the difference is totally unfeasible.

Making a neural network to do the same thing is feasible and scalible, it just takes time and skilled developers.

For starters, hands on work. I'd have a team looking into it. Part of the problem there is Riot is indie levels with mainstream popularity. They've not had practice with this like Blizzard. Anything, at this point, is good-- if they never respond but in the same way, what can they expect to learn or develop?? They've been relying on the same solution to the same problem that isn't solved. So what vindicates their method over any other?

But I think the real problem is that League is sustained by its competitive scene. Because of that, it's got a ton of attention at the lower levels; but these lower levels are not welcomed in as much as simply invited. The difference is, of course, in the notion that these problems exist in spades while they keep their attention on the front end. All the hands-on work is in the form of micronerfs and microbuffs that most players won't be interacting with. No problem-- except Riot has a history with tunnel vision.

They do waves of bans as a means of countermeasure but that doesn't save the games ruined by them. Perhaps discouraging the notions for which these Botting programs are useful would help. The problem is that they ruin a game they're in and there's no recourse, really. This is unfortunate for new players who will be getting (somewhat accurately) an idea of the responsiveness they can expect from Riot over these matters.

No other game that I've played has quite the issue this game does. Their lower echelons are crammed full of spam. I don't know why it is-- I do know I surely wouldn't shy away from responses over not being certain they'll work. As long as it persists, it is a problem that should be addressed.

Simply trying to invalidate our arguments by saying we've not pitched a perfect idea is just goofy; I appreciate defending Riot but please don't rely on fallacies. Me not being able to singlehandedly fix it does not mean discussion is not to be had; and if they had the resources they would be dedicated. I never said they were incapable or incompetent, just that the newer players are seen as easily cloyed (such as giving them free stuff to shut them up about bot problems?) and have less 'sway' for not being well-versed in the game. I think addressing that before it becomes more notorious is a healthy direction for this game.

The real kicker here is what gain is in all this. Once we figure out THEIR endgame, Riot can work towards snuffing it out. Until then, we're all treading water.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Fuzzi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-02-18T06:22:44.793+0000)
>
> For starters, hands on work. I'd have a team looking into it. Part of the problem there is Riot is indie levels with mainstream popularity. They've not had practice with this like Blizzard. Anything, at this point, is good-- if they never respond but in the same way, what can they expect to learn or develop?? They've been relying on the same solution to the same problem that isn't solved. So what vindicates their method over any other?
> 
> But I think the real problem is that League is sustained by its competitive scene. Because of that, it's got a ton of attention at the lower levels; but these lower levels are not welcomed in as much as simply invited. The difference is, of course, in the notion that these problems exist in spades while they keep their attention on the front end. All the hands-on work is in the form of micronerfs and microbuffs that most players won't be interacting with. No problem-- except Riot has a history with tunnel vision.
> 
> They do waves of bans as a means of countermeasure but that doesn't save the games ruined by them. Perhaps discouraging the notions for which these Botting programs are useful would help. The problem is that they ruin a game they're in and there's no recourse, really. This is unfortunate for new players who will be getting (somewhat accurately) an idea of the responsiveness they can expect from Riot over these matters.
> 
> No other game that I've played has quite the issue this game does. Their lower echelons are crammed full of spam. I don't know why it is-- I do know I surely wouldn't shy away from responses over not being certain they'll work. As long as it persists, it is a problem that should be addressed.
> 
> Simply trying to invalidate our arguments by saying we've not pitched a perfect idea is just goofy; I appreciate defending Riot but please don't rely on fallacies. Me not being able to singlehandedly fix it does not mean discussion is not to be had; and if they had the resources they would be dedicated. I never said they were incapable or incompetent, just that the newer players are seen as easily cloyed (such as giving them free stuff to shut them up about bot problems?) and have less 'sway' for not being well-versed in the game. I think addressing that before it becomes more notorious is a healthy direction for this game.
> 
> The real kicker here is what gain is in all this. Once we figure out THEIR endgame, Riot can work towards snuffing it out. Until then, we're all treading water.

Who are "They"?

If you mean bots, they are just leveled to 30 and sold to trash that got banned. The goal is leveling them as fast as possible.

Banning them is the only option, there is no way to fix a game with bots in it. Bans happen in waves because it is the only efficient way to do it, and the only way to prevent the botters from easily bypassing the system.

If every bot was detected and banned within a few games, it would make it incredibly easy to determine how bots are detected and change their behavior to remain undetected. It is an arms-race to the bottom that the botters win every single time - they can throw more time, money and resources at it, surprisingly - most of them are based in china with dirt-cheap labor costs.

The game is good about determining if you are a real new player or a smurf.  

If you are a smurf the fresh account experience is garbage. Too bad. Get over it.

If you are a real new player you WILL get matched with other new players. I've tested this myself. Although some new players are salty to begin with, everyone is truly a newb and you can have a really good time. ONLY if you're *actually* a newbie though.

You've "tested" it...

I thought the game could determine smurfs so how?

It's called having friends.  

Is this a foreign concept to you?

Then that's not doing it yourself now is it?

And how exactly would this "friend" be able to prove your claim even if they did exist? Do you have their match statistics proving they don't get bots and smurfs like the real new players do?

Is having a legitimate argument a foreign concept to you?

Wow you really don't have real friends do you.  

You go to their house and you watch them play.  

I feel bad for you bro. I'll come gank your house bro if you like sometime.

If you want to call it that, but your aggressive and hostile attitude towards not only me but nearly every participant in your discussion is not something I would call a victory. You can "win" the argument but I couldn't care less about a poor host like you. Only looking to belittle and attack the opposition rather than actually have a discussion. But oh yeah i forgot you don't value friends, evident by the fact that you have none. Well that settles it. Have fun alone bud.

Quickly, Leave league with me and I know as a fact that Riot will have to listen to us. 

If enough people leave, the game will be next to empty and Riot won't be getting skin revenue.

This as a result means that we will have Riot in our hands and ready to actually fix the game!!

There are very few people reading Boards compared to total players playing and even less people would actually leave the game. They won't spot a difference in amount of players while also a lot of new players are joining League.

Riot has lied on their numbers before.


During the "data" Riot showed for an "explanation" of why toplane was somehow "perfectly fine" was that the most picked role was TOP IN VIETNAM BRONZE.

That was an actual statistic that Riot was using as "perfect evidence that toplane is in a solid state".

Any other company and those employees would be fired on the spot!!!

> [{quoted}](name=ComeGankMeBro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-02-18T02:56:02.440+0000)
>
> pretty much everyone is a smurf because no new people ever really can put up with and stay in the garbage League has devolved into

Not what the statistics say.
What statistics? Riot hasn't released population stats in years
You do know that new players are rarely of ever matched with bots or smurfs right?  Also, enemy bots cannot get fed.  Literally impossible.

They can in fact get fed when against bots that walk under tower to auto.

And yes, bots are usually in every coop or aram, it's rare when they're Not

No they cant.  Bots do not gain gold.  They automatically get items at certain times specifically to prevent them from getting fed.  Bots _cannot_ be fed.  And again, new players, aren't matched with bots.
They aren't matched vs bots in coop v ai?
You know that was a typo.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qg5iJYvU,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-02-18T08:23:20.214+0000)
>
> You do know that new players are rarely of ever matched with bots or smurfs right?  Also, enemy bots cannot get fed.  Literally impossible.

you do know that you're wrong and you need to stay quiet because you don't know what you're talking about, **right?** New players constantly get matched to bots and smurfs. I hate it when people spread misinformation.

New players are matched with smurfs when they outperform their peers. The system detects them as smurfs and as a result (solo mmr) matches them with players closer to the same gameplay level.Im a smurf and im constantly fighting other smurfs and when I do fight a actual new player they arent that bad really, but when a real new player is really bad they are paired with bots and its sad.

Except, no.  They dont.  Youre the one spreading misinfo.  New players very rarely get matched with smurfs or bots.  This is actually common knowledge on the boards and ive seen people tell you this before bramble.

Hmm are you a smurf? Just curious.

From what I'v heard riot's ai is actually pretty damn decent at segregating smurfs and new players.
It actually is.  Smurfs seem to think their smurf games are indicative of new player experience.
It's not, seeing as I've only played less than 5 games in normals before getting sick of it, not enough data for riots supposed smurf detector to actually work.
Bot games count too? Also the "Are you experienced with MMOS" and tutorial skiping I think.

>**No one calls out their picks**

As someone who played 2000 Normal Blind picks (not lying, can provide a picture) I can say this is very invalid, only legitimate trolls and the like will actually not say their call and still lock in. There are rarely 3+ man premades so that isn't really a viable point, there are little to no smurfs (why would there be smurfs in normals other than making **OMG!!! 500/0/999 KDA DIAMOND SKILL LEVEL PLAYER WITH MMR OF BRONZIE** videos) and it's much more casual and less toxic (and more approachable) than ranked.

And get on your main.

Done, try making a new account and actually put your money where your mouth is denouncer.

Prove it
Prove what? Put the picture in or play on a new account? Besides, I already have a younger relative player to use as proof if need be.
Then do so? Nothing stopping you

Actually, having watched new friends on new accounts, I was actually quite surprised at how good Riot's system is at identifying smurfs.  They rarely run into players more skilled than they are, at least not to the point where I'd guess those players are smurfs.

Also, I've never seen a new player complaining about fighting for farm, or not having a support.  It's a completely player driven convention, that new players wouldn't even know about.  The guy complaining about lack of a support is almost always some scrub on a smurf trying to stomp on new players.

Ok, are you actually new?  Or a guy trying to level up a Smurf?  Because I've been new, I've watched new players get into game and they don't face those issues most of the time.  I've only seen it happen to old players making new accounts, on which case they deserve all that shit because the only reason a player would make a new account is if their first one got banned, or if they want to pub stomp lower elo players because they're tired of losing to people at their own elo.
He's a smurf thinking he knows what's up

He's a player from other MOBAs that's pointing things out actually.

But whatever ignorant fantasies help you sleep at night denouncer.

That still counts.

They just separate experienced vs not experienced because 90% of experienced are smurfs.
